content:
Hi all!

Been lurking for a while. My name is Rowan and I'm an MS student in California. My main interest here at the moment is to explore Rust's ownership and lifetime system. At the moment I am in the research stage and hope to transition into a thesis on the topic this summer. If anyone has any pointers (heh), points of contact, or things they could share about the ownership system I would love to hear them.

Nice to meet you,

Rowan
Also, the rustc dev guide is probably the best reference we have about the compiler. There is a chapter on the borrow checker there.
Thanks! I was also thinking about talking to the Polonius group if possible.
I don't know how active polonius is
